THE SECRET BOX-BASED ON A REAL CHILDHOOD EVENT.


My parents dont know that I have it; its my box, my secret box and theres all kinds of great stuff in there. It does'nt have a lock on it and its not very pretty, in fact its gray. However, I put my own decorations on the front, drawings that I  colored all by myself with a magic marker.  Most of the time, I stay in my room and study all the things that I have inside when my parents fight.  They fight on the phone a lot, so I usually like to stay out of it, however sometimes (and my momma doesnt know this) I come out of my room and I hide behind the counter where she can't see me. While shes talking to my dad or to her friends about really serious things, I take notes on a little sheet of paper.  I listen closely and I write down the things that seem the most important.  Sometimes momma says that she does'nt wanna live anymore, most of the time she is crying. There are other times when she says that "she's losing control" and im not exactly sure what that means, but I know it must be real bad.  It hurts the most when she says that she doesnt think she can handle taking care of me by herself.    
I have to know these things because at ten-years old i am grown up enough to protect and take care of  my momma, I mean its my job as a little girl, after all. Later, I go back to my room and put my new notes in my secret box, I always make sure that its hidden away real good. 

Today, a man is coming over to paint the outside of the house, so its kinda a mess out there. Momma was on the phone again today, though.  She was fighting with my dad again.  I know that they say all kinds of words to each other that I shouldnt hear, cuss words, lots of them.  I wonder what they are fighting about? Its probably about me or maybe its not, either way its scary.

I know my dad is the bad guy though, because that's what momma says, and I believe anything that she says. I get tired of the screaming anyway so I decide to go outside and watch the men paint the house, I don't talk to them because im kinda shy, I just watch and they dont mind. Maybe they like kids? A little while later I notice my dad's dark colored car pull into our driveway, I had no idea he was coming over today, I wonder if he wants to see me, probably not. 

When my momma comes outside to meet him, I decide to go back into the house and hide, I don't want any part of this. I feel really sad that I went inside though, really sad. My dad is gone all of a sudden, he left really really quick. "Oh my gosh, whats going on now," I wonder. 

Something bad happened while I was inside, something really bad. I know because my momma is screaming and crying and I dont know what to do. She didn't tell me what happened, she got on the phone again instead. The men have stopped painting outside.  She wants to call the police, she said the painter's saw everything but they werent sure if they should get involved. I know that they were yelling bad, bad words at each other, they were really loud. My dad lost his temper, he doesnt like being disrepected, not even by me. I guess Dad had had enough because he grabbed her, he grabbed her by both wrists, then he slammed her against the bricks, I think her head might have even been bleeding. She couldnt get free, he wouldnt let her go, he slammed her around a lot. Then he grabbed her by the throat, really hard almost so she couldnt breath, he tried to choke her so she would die, then he drove away.   

 
When I found out, i ran inside the house as fast as my legs could take me, I needed my secret box, right now!  I needed what was inside and quick!  I fiddled with the top, I had trouble getting it open because I was shaking and my hands were all sweaty. Since,  Im not allowed to have a real knife, I decided to make my own a little while ago. I made it out of two  popsicle sticks and with the sharpest rock that I could find glued right on the end. my dad hurt my mom, he really hurt her. 

I run back outside, out of breath and holding the "knife" as tight as I can. I hide around the back of the house, just in case my dad decides to come back. I look up at my swing-set for a moment, seems like a dumb thing for a strong ten-year-old like me to have. Momma doesnt need to call the cops, because as long as have my "knife" I can handle it myself.  Momma doesnt know that i'll protect her (even if my dad wants to kill me too)  I hold the "knife" in my hands and I make a promise to myself.  I promise that if my dad ever hits my mom again I'll kill him, thats what i'll do. I'll kill him. I'll stab him right through his heart and i'll make blood run all over the ground. I wont even care.  I'll be glad if hes dead,   I'll stab him because I can do it, because im a big kid. 

Dad never came back, I guess that was good for him, because of my plan. Momma doesnt even know about the notes or my "knife" thats why my ugly gray box is my little secret, and Ive never needed it anymore than I did today.  

Later, after the day is finally over and im in bed,  I wish someone would protect me too.  I keep thinking over and over what if my dad comes back and hits me or kidnaps me or something horrible!  I just cant protect everybody. See, most of the time, no one protects kids during a divorce, we have to protect ourselves and our parents too. 

All i can do is lay down all by myself and worry and leave my mom on the phone. Will she get the cops to come and arrest my dad? What will happen? I guess as long as i have my secret box, i'll be okay.
